answers.author: Tad McGalliard
answers.text:
Hi Tim, the American Planning Association has published a PAS report on wind energy.  "Planning for Wind Energy." Suzanne Rynne, AICP, Larry Flowers, Eric Lantz, and Erica Heller, AICP (eds.). 2011.  You have to be a member of APA to receive a free copy, but you may want to contact Suzanne Rynne (srynne@planning.org) to see what  they could do.

answers.text:
And you may also want to contact Phillip Moore, who is the city manager over in Alma.  My understanding is that they have put together a regional plan for wind power that has streamlined the zoning, planning and inspection processes across jurisdictions.  His email address is pmoore@ci.alma.mi.us.

author: Timothy McLean
text: I am interested in hearing about any ordinances that are in effect that regulate residential wind turbines in your communities. Our Planning Commission is currently looking into the creation of this type of ordinance. Because there is very little potential for any type of large scale wind turbines to be erected in the community, the focus is primarily on potential residential wind turbines. As it is a major safety issue,  I am particularly interested in learning more about setback requirements for residential turbines.
title: Residential Wind Turbines
